metadata.title: Easy Kerala Style Ghee Rice- Easy and Best tasting NeyChoru Recipe
metadata.description:
Delectable and aromatic basmati rice cooked in ghee, this goes well with Chicken curry or Mutton curry.
Recipe on the blog: http://www.thasneen.com/cooking/ghee-rice/

Connect with me via:
Fb: https://www.facebook.com/CookingwithThas/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/thasneen

transcription: [00:00.000] For making ghee rice, either basmati rice or jeerakasala rice can be used.
[00:05.000] In a large bowl, soak the rice in water for 15 minutes.
[00:12.000] After 15 minutes, drain the water & rinse the rice taken in a strainer till the water gets clear. Keep aside the rice.
[00:20.000] Coarsely grind the ingredients to grind: ginger, garlic, green chilies, whole cardamom, whole cloves, cinnamon. Keep aside.
[00:30.000] Place a large saucepan over medium heat, add the ghee.
[00:35.000] To the ghee, add bay leaves, onions, season with 1 tsp salt, sauté until the onions turn translucent.
[00:45.000] Add the ground mixture, sauté for 3 minutes until the raw smell of the ginger/garlic goes away. Don't burn the spices.
[00:52.000] Add the rice and sauté for 3 minutes. Don't let the rice turn brown. It gets aromatic.
[01:03.000] Season with 1 tsp salt, combine well.
[01:05.000] Cover the saucepan with its lid and cook over medium heat for 10 to 12 minutes until all the water has dried off & the rice has turned fluffy & soft.
[01:19.000] Take the pan off the heat & keep it covered for a few minutes- the rice will set well.
[01:23.000] Fry the onions in oil or ghee until golden brown, transfer to a paper towel.
[01:28.000] Roast cashew nuts in the oil or ghee used for frying onion until golden, keep aside in a paper towel.
[01:33.000] Roast raisins in oil or ghee till it bubbles up, keep aside.
[01:38.000] Garnish the cooked ghee rice with fried onions, roasted cashew nuts, roasted raisins and cilantro.
[01:43.000] Keep it covered for 5 minutes, the aroma will infuse into the rice.
[01:48.000] Serve warm with chicken, mutton or beef curries. Enjoy!
